resources.string: The gate sets its output only if both inputs are active.
The gate sets its output only if at least one input is not active.
The gate sets its output if at least one input is active.
The gate sets its output only if both inputs are not active.
The gate sets its output only if both inputs are different.
The gate sets its output only if both inputs are identical.
The gate sets its output only if the input is not active.

This is your chance to show what you know about the most important logic gates.

Each puzzle shows one logic gate - touch it to get some more information. Below the gate the states of the inputs are shown and it is your task to choose the correct output state just above the gate.

If you are right you get some points between 1 and 100 - depending on how fast you were. Otherweise there are no points and to get the next puzzle you have to confirm the correct state.
